answers.answer: do you have a reason to believe your friend has HIV?

Same question as Joey plus a new one: Why the hell are your friends poking themselves with YOUR needles? I'm sure you are negative (if they are), but this should be a lesson to you or your friends in stupid needless behavior (I've learned mine my situation).

So let me get this straight...you let people you don't know enter your house, draw blood with your needles, and then you used the SAME needles later? You were most definitely at risk if you do not know their status. This is exactly how IDU's transmit HIV (sharing needles). If you don't know their status, I'm not sure how this can be considered not at risk. Sorry to be blunt, man.
some of the guys who were at my house I dont even know....so I cant judge on their status...anyway, I agree that that their actions were stupid, but was I at risk ??

Don't mean to scare you; chances are you're fine. Let this be a lesson to YOU (not your idiot friends); do not do something this brainless again (your actions were just as stupid as theirs).(-coming from the king of brainless activities...takes one to know one, heh)
yeah, I know what I did was stupid...but I didnt mean it, it happened by accident...and doesnt the fact that I used the needle two days later means that the virus would be gone?

Go to your MD and ask these questions. Not to scare you, but none of us here know if the blood was dry on your needle (inactivating the virus). Like I said before, chances are you're fine. You will still want to get tested after sharing needles, I would believe.
You weren't at risk for HIV since you did not force anything into your veins. Go back to using a lancet.
yes teak, I didnt force it into my veins...I merely punctured my skin on my finger to squeeze some blood out. Besides, the needle didnt have any visible blood on it. Are u sure I am ok Teak?
There's your answer. Still, I don't care what Teak says, I wouldn't share needles of any kind / use. It doesn't seem smart.
The needle was not used to exchange fluids as are done with IV drug users sharing works. You didn't have a risk.

question: HelloI know what I did was stupid but please hear me out and advise...I have some vacutainer needles at my house. Sometimes when I want to do my diabetes test and I cant find the needles to draw blood I use those. Two days ago, some friend of mine where at my house and they were playing with one of those needles and poking themselves with them and they drew blood from one of the guys..then they put the cap back on and returned the needle to the drawer. Today, by mistake, I used the same needle to draw blood from my finger. Now I am petrefied and scared...was I at risk? I used the needle two days after my friends used it.....am I at risk? should I start PEP?
title: Serious Question....Serious Risk ?
